enWisdom: Vileness is the foundation of evil
The vile ones are the most patient physically [but are weakest in spirit]
Vileness is the accumulator of dispraise
Vileness necessitates deceit
There is wickedness with obligation
Doing acts of kindness along with obligation is vileness
The vile one has no magnanimity
The vile person is never ashamed
The favour of an ignoble person is the worst depravity
The vile person is one who puts a lot of obligation [on others when he does any good to them]
Vileness is preferring wealth over people
Vileness is ugly so do not make it your attire

Wisdom: اللَّئِيمُ إِذَا قَدَرَ أَفْحَشَ وَإِذَا وَعَدَ أَخْلَفَ
enWisdom: The vile one is such that when he has the power, he commits atrocities and when he makes a promise, he breaks it

Wisdom: اللَّئِيمُ إِذَا أَعْطَى حَقَدَ وَإِذَا أُعْطِيَ جَحَدَ
enWisdom: The vile one is such that when he gives, he does begrudgingly and when he is given something, he is ungrateful

Wisdom: اللَّئِيمُ إِذَا بَلَغَ فَوْقَ مِقْدَارِهِ تَنَكَّرَتْ أَحْوَالُهُ
enWisdom: When the vile one attains a position above his status, his condition changes [for the worse]

Wisdom: اللَّئِيمُ يَجْفُو إِذَا اسْتُعْطِفَ وَيَلِينُ إِذَا عُنِّفَ
enWisdom: The vile one is harsh when he is approached entreatingly and becomes soft when he is berated

Wisdom: اللُّؤْمُ إِيثَارُ حُبِّ الْمَالِ عَلَى لَذَّةِ الْحَمْدِ وَالثَّنَاءِ
enWisdom: Vileness is preferring the love of wealth over the delight of praise and commendation

Wisdom: اللَّئِيمُ لَا يَتْبَعُ [لَا يَتَّسِعُ‏] إِلَّا شَكْلَهُ وَلَا يَمِيلُ إِلَّا إِلَى مِثْلِهِ
enWisdom: The vile person does not follow anyone except the one who is like him and he does not incline towards anyone but the one who is similar to him

Wisdom: اللَّئِيمُ لَا يُرْجَى خَيْرُهُ وَلَا يُسْلَمُ مِنْ شَرِّهِ وَلَا يُؤْمَنُ مِنْ غَوَائِلِهِ
enWisdom: No good is expected from a vile person, and no one is safe from his evil and secure from his ills
The vile one dons the attire of dishonour and harms the freemen

Wisdom: اللَّئِيمُ يَرَى سَوَالِفَ إِحْسَانِهِ دَيْناً لَهُ يَقْتَضِيهِ
enWisdom: The vile one considers his favours as debts that he will demand repayment for [in the future]

Wisdom: اللَّئِيمُ [الْحَلِيمُ‏] يُعْلِي هِمَّتَهُ فِيمَا جُنِيَ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ طَلَبِ سُوءِ الْمُكَافَاةِ
enWisdom: The vile one spares no effort in seeking evil vengeance for the wrong that has been done to him

Wisdom: اللَّئِيمُ إِذَا احْتَاجَ إِلَيْكَ أَجْفَاكَ [أَعْيَاكَ‏] إِذَا احْتَجْتَ إِلَيْهِ عَنَاكَ [أغناك‏]
enWisdom: The vile one is such that when he needs you he puts you in difficulty, and when you need him he torments you

Wisdom: اللُّؤْمُ مُضَادٌّ لِسَائِرِ الْفَضَائِلِ وَجَامِعٌ لِجَمِيعِ الرَّذَائِلِ وَالسَّوْآتِ وَالدَّنَايَا
enWisdom: Vileness is the opposite of all the virtues and the combination of all the vices, evils and lowly traits
The greatest vileness is praising the blameworthy
The best favour of the wicked person is holding back his harm [from others]
When you come upon vile [and miserly] people then give the excuse of fasting [so that you may leave them without partaking of a meal]

Wisdom: إِذَا بَلَغَ اللَّئِيمُ فَوْقَ مِقْدَارِهِ تَنَكَّرَتْ أَحْوَالُهُ
enWisdom: When the vile one attains a position above his status, his condition changes [for the worse]

Wisdom: إِذَا زَادَكَ اللَّئِيمُ إِجْلَالًا فَزِدْهُ إِذْلَالًا
enWisdom: When the vile one increases his reverence for you then increase your scorn for him
The practice of the vile ones is denial
The triumph of a vile person leads to destruction
The triumph of vile people leads to haughtiness and defiance
The shadow [and patronage] of the vile ones is [an] endemic adversity

Wisdom: عَادَةُ اللِّئَامِ الْمُكَافَاةُ بِالْقَبِيحِ عَنِ الْإِحْسَانِ
enWisdom: The habit of vile people is to repay good with evil
The habit of vile people is denial [the blessings they have been given]

Wisdom: عِزُّ اللَّئِيمِ مَذَلَّةٌ وَضَلَالُ الْعَقْلِ أَشَدُّ ضَلَّةٍ
enWisdom: The honour of a vile person is humiliation and the deviation of the intellect is the worst deviation

Wisdom: عُقُوبَةُ الْكِرَامِ أَحْسَنُ مِنْ عَفْوِ اللِّئَامِ
enWisdom: The punishment of noble ones is better than the forgiveness of the vile ones

Wisdom: فِرُّوا كُلَّ الْفِرَارِ مِنَ اللَّئِيمِ الْأَحْمَقِ
enWisdom: Flee as far as you can from the foolish, vile one
Absence of vile people is a [source of] comfort for the people

Wisdom: فَاقَةُ الْكَرِيمِ أَحْسَنُ مِنْ غَنَاءِ اللَّئِيمِ
enWisdom: The poverty of the honourable one is better than the wealth of the vile one
A vice may debase [the one who commits it]

Wisdom: كُلَّمَا ارْتَفَعَتْ رُتْبَةُ اللَّئِيمِ نَقَصَ النَّاسُ عِنْدَهُ وَالْكَرِيمُ ضِدُّ ذَلِكَ
enWisdom: Every time the rank of a vile person is raised, the people around him diminish, whereas the honourable one is the opposite of this
One whose reproach increases, his disgrace increases

Wisdom: مَنْ جُمِعَ لَهُ مَعَ الْحِرْصِ عَلَى الدُّنْيَا الْبُخْلُ بِهَا فَقَدِ اسْتَمْسَكَ بِعَمُودَيِ اللُّؤْمِ
enWisdom: One for whom greed of worldly possessions is coupled with stinginess has held fast to the two pillars of ignobility
Hard-heartedness is from the traits of the vile ones
One of the ugliest blameworthy acts [of a person] is praising the wicked

Wisdom: مِنْ أَعْظَمِ اللُّؤْمِ إِحْرَازُ الْمَرْءِ نَفْسَهُ وَإِسْلَامُهُ عِرْسَهُ
enWisdom: It is from the greatest vileness for a man to protect himself while surrendering his wife

Wisdom: مِنَ اللُّؤْمِ أَنْ يَصُونَ الرَّجُلُ مَالَهُ وَيَبْذُلَ عِرْضَهُ
enWisdom: It is from vileness for a person to preserve his wealth and sacrifice his dignity [instead]

Wisdom: مَا أَقْبَحَ شِيَمَ اللِّئَامِ وَأَحْسَنَ سَجَايَا الْكِرَامِ
enWisdom: How detestable are the traits of the vile and how good are the qualities of the honourable!

Wisdom: مَنْعُ الْكَرِيمِ أَحْسَنُ مِنْ إِعْطَاءِ [عَطَاءِ] اللَّئِيمِ
enWisdom: The withholding of the honourable one is better than the granting of the vile one

Wisdom: مُعَادَاةُ الْكَرِيمِ أَسْلَمُ مِنْ مُصَادَقَةِ اللَّئِيمِ
enWisdom: Enmity with the honourable is safer than friendship with the wicked
The joy of the wicked is in evil retribution
The wicked do not do good to anyone except those who are like them
There is no wickedness more ruthless than hard-heartedness
The noble person does not seek justice from the wicked
